bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Illness Sign identical with han zhong 寒腫 , cold swelling. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Zang fu xu shi biao ben yao shi 臟腑虛實標本用藥式：（肾）本病：諸寒厥逆，骨痿腰痛，腰冷如 冰，足胻腫寒 , “The diseases [of the kidneys] themselves: All types of cold with recession and [qi] counterflow, bone dysfunction and lower back pain, the lower back is ice cold, the feet and shins are swollen and cold ”. Zhong han 中寒 , struck by cold; cold stroke; cold center [14]

a) of dizziness and wry mouth brought forth by a strong cold stroke. San yin ji yi bing zheng fang lun 三因極一病證方論 2: 乾薑附子湯，治中寒，卒然暈倒…口噤，四肢厥冷 , “Decoction with gan jiang and fu zi cures cold stroke with sudden unconsciousness and fall to the ground, …clenched jaw, and recession cold in the four limbs”.

b) Identical with han zhong 寒中 , cold center. Jin gui yao lue 金匱要略 Fj: 中寒，其人下利，以裏虛也 , 欲 嚏不能，此人肚中寒 , “Patients with a cold center experience free-flux illness because of internal depletion. They feel an urge to sneeze but are unable to do so. This is cold in a person’s abdomen”.
